title: Luke Shaw: Manchester United flop is guaranteed the boot this summer… something has gone terribly wrong for him
text:
Comments HE was supposed to be the next big footballing superstar at Old Trafford. 
Coveted by the country’s top clubs and taken to the 2014 World Cup in place of Ashley Cole aged just 18, Luke Shaw looked to have it all. PA:Press Association Archive Luke Shaw’s time at Manchester United will come to an end this summer 
Something, somewhere, has gone very wrong with his career. Keep up to date with all the latest news, gossip, rumours and done deals in SunSport’s live transfer blog 
The end of a tortuous spell at Manchester United — the termination of his relationship with Jose Mourinho — cannot come soon enough. 
Boss Mourinho will happily wave him on his way. 
This summer will be Shaw’s chance to start afresh, to leave the Special One behind and start playing first-team football again. 
Shaw would dearly love to be reunited with Mauricio Pochettino at Tottenham . Saturday Premier League match preview featuring Liverpool v Everton Reuters 7 Jose Mourinho has had enough of dealing with the left-back 
They have a special relationship, a rapport built during the defender’s rapid progress when he was a young player at Southampton . 
Shaw, earning £130,000-a-week at Old Trafford following his initial £27million move from St Mary’s, is desperate to work with him again. 
Poch got the best out of his protege on the South Coast, putting structure into his life and teaching him how to become a top-class professional. 
The days of Shaw running through the bushes after training and picking up two bags of wine gums on the way home were over when the Argentine arrived in English football.

Shaw responded to his methods, repaying Pochettino’s faith with a remarkable run that took him into England’s World Cup squad. 
In Germany last week, he did not carry himself like an England international. 
Shaw looked out of shape and out of condition when Gareth Southgate sent for him with seven minutes left in Dortmund. 
His stock has fallen with the Three Lions and he is now third in the queue behind a fit Danny Rose and Ryan Bertrand . 
He returned to United this week but the reality is he cannot wait to get away from Old Trafford. Action Images 7 Shaw would love the chance to work with Mauricio Pochettino once again 
Marcus Rojo , Daley Blind and Matteo Darmian have all been preferred to him at left-back during another difficult season. 
Behind the scenes, the tension with Mourinho remains. 
They have never really found a way past the meeting with Shaw and his family in 2014, that ended sourly when Mourinho was Chelsea manager. 
With Shaw’s Surrey roots and his well-known affection for the Blues as his boyhood club, a transfer from the Saints to Stamford Bridge looked like a tap-in. 
Instead, Mourinho was left angered by the youngster’s apparent pre- occupation with money instead of the chance to move to Chelsea. PA:Press Association 7 Shaw looked out of shape during his brief England cameo last week 
In return, Shaw’s family were not impressed by Mourinho and were never quite convinced he was his preferred target. Their relationship has never really recovered. 
The latest run-in came following the 1-1 draw with Bournemouth on March 4, when United’s manager laid into him after he started talking to some of Eddie Howe’s players. 
Shaw, who was shocked by the outburst, has not played a single minute since then. 
Mourinho’s demands are high, with his record of winning trophies over the years giving him significant clout in the dressing room. PA:Press Association 7 The best thing for Shaw would be a fresh start with the guarantee of regular action 
He is entitled to expect every Manchester United player to be the ultimate professional, fully focused and committed to meeting the enormous demands of the club. 
The Special One has not had that from Shaw. 
The left-back has retreated into his shell, with his confidence shaken after failing to settle into that famous red shirt. 
For that reason, Shaw has to start all over again.
